sen.j: 池坊 専永（いけのぼう せんえい、1933年7月21日 -）は京都府出身の華道家。
sen.e: Senei IKENOBO (July 21, 1933 -) is a flower arrangement expert from Kyoto Prefecture.
Senei IKENOBO (July 21, 1933 -) is a flower arrangement expert from Kyoto Prefecture.
Senei IKENOBO (July 21, 1933 -) is a flower arrangement expert from Kyoto Prefecture.
He is a Doshisha University graduate.
He is a Doshisha University graduate.
He is a Doshisha University graduate.

sen.j: 華道家元四十四世池坊専威の長男である。
sen.e: He is the first son of the 44th generation flower arrangement expert Seni IKENOBO.
He is the eldest son of the 44th flower arrangement expert Seni IKENOBO.
sen.cmt: the first son>>the eldest songeneration を削除しました。
sen.e: He is the eldest son of the 44th flower arrangement expert Seni IKENOBO.

sen.j: 妻は衆議院議員の池坊保子、長女は次期家元池坊由紀である。
sen.e: His wife is Yasuko IKENOBO, a member of the House of Representatives, and his eldest daughter is Yuki IKENOBO who will be the next iemoto (the head of the school).
His wife is Yasuko IKENOBO, a member of the House of Representatives, and his eldest daughter is Yuki IKENOBO who will be the next iemoto (the head of the school).
His wife is Yasuko IKENOBO, a member of the House of Representatives, and his eldest daughter is Yuki IKENOBO who will be the next iemoto (the head of the school).

sen.j: 1945年：父の専威の急逝で、四十五世を継承、京都の青蓮院で得度する。
sen.e: 1945: After the sudden death of his father Seni, Senei became the 45th generation iemoto and entered the priesthood at Shoren-in temple in Kyoto Prefecture.
1945: After the sudden death of his father Seni, Senei became the 45th generation iemoto and entered the priesthood at Shoren-in temple in Kyoto Prefecture.
1945: After the sudden death of his father Seni, Senei became the 45th generation iemoto and entered the priesthood at Shoren-in temple in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 1946年：比叡山中学校・高等学校に入学。
sen.e: 1946: He entered Hiei-zan Junior and then Senior High School.
1946: He entered Hiei-zan Junior and then Senior High School.
1946: He entered Hiei-zan Junior and then Senior High School.

sen.j: 僧侶の修行のため慈照院で生活する。
sen.e: He lived at Jisho-in Temple to as a part of Buddhist practice.
He lived at Jisho-in Temple as a part of Buddhist practice.
sen.cmt: 「to」が必要ないかと思われます。
sen.e: He lived at Jisho-in Temple for the ascetic training of Buddhism.
sen.cmt: より自然な訳にしました。

sen.j: 1953年：紫雲山頂法寺の住職に就任する。
sen.e: 1953: He became the chief priest of Shiunzan Chohoji Temple.
1953: He became the chief priest of Shiunzan Chohoji Temple.
1953: He became the chief priest of Shiunzan Chohoji Temple.

sen.j: 1962年：徳力富治郎とともに、初めての海外で活動を行う。
sen.e: 1962: Together with Tomijiro TOKURIKI, he expanded his career beyond Japan for the first time.
sen.cmt: 徳力富治郎→Tomijiro TOKURIKI (読み方不明)
sen.e: 1962: Together with Tomijiro TOKURIKI, he expanded his career beyond Japan for the first time.
1962: Together with Tomijiro TOKURIKI, he expanded his career beyond Japan for the first time.

sen.j: 1971年：東京銀座松坂屋で初の古典を行う。
sen.e: 1971: He held his first exhibition at a department store called Matsuzakaya in Ginza, Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 古典→個展と解釈し、そのように訳出しました。
sen.e: 1971: He held his first exhibition at a department store called Matsuzakaya in Ginza, Tokyo.
1971: He held his first exhibition at a department store called Matsuzakaya in Ginza, Tokyo.

sen.j: 1973年：ネスカフェのCMに出演する。
sen.e: 1973: He was featured in a NESCAFE TV commercial.
1973: He was featured in a NESCAFE TV commercial.
1973: He was featured in a NESCAFE TV commercial.

sen.j: 1985年：国際科学技術博覧会で「いけばなときものの交響詩」で舞台用の超大作を制作する。
sen.e: 1985: For the International Exposition, Tsukuba, Japan, 1985, he created a huge flower arrangement to decorate the stage of 'Ikebana to Kimono no Kokyoshi' (A Symphonic Poem of Flower Arrangement and Kimono).

1985: For the International Exposition Tsukuba, Japan 1985, he created a huge flower arrangement to decorate the stage of 'Ikebana to Kimono no Kokyoshi' (A Symphonic Poem of Flower Arrangement and Kimono).
sen.cmt: 英語ウェブサイトの、国際科学技術博覧会表記では「、」はTsukubaとJapanの間だけのものがあったので、名称として分かりやすいのでそちらを使用します。
sen.e: 1985: For the International Exposition Tsukuba, Japan 1985, he created a huge flower arrangement to decorate the stage of 'Ikebana to Kimono no Kokyoshi' (A Symphonic Poem of Flower Arrangement and Kimono).

sen.j: 個展、国内・海外の普及活動だけでなく、執筆、講演会を行っている。
sen.e: Not only holding exhibitions or disseminating Japanese flower arrangement both domestically and internationally, he also writes and gives lectures.
Not only holding exhibitions or disseminating Japanese flower arrangement both domestically and internationally, he also writes and gives lectures.
Not only holding exhibitions or disseminating Japanese flower arrangement both domestically and internationally, he also writes and gives lectures.
1971: He received the Medal with Dark Blue Ribbon.
1971: He received the Medal with Dark Blue Ribbon.
1971: He received the Medal with Dark Blue Ribbon.

sen.j: オールデン・アカデミコ・デ・サンフランシスコ章受章（ブラジル）。
sen.e: He also received the Orden Academico De San Francisco award (Brazil)
He also received the Orden Academico De San Francisco award (Brazil)
He also received the Orden Academico De San Francisco award (Brazil)

sen.j: 1995年：南十字星勲章受章（ブラジル）。
sen.e: 1955: He received the Medal of the Southern Cross (Brazil)
1955: He received the Medal of the Southern Cross (Brazil)
1955: He received the Medal of the Southern Cross (Brazil)

sen.j: 2005年：旭日中綬章受章（いけばな界では初の受章となる）。
sen.e: 2005: He received the Order of the Rising Sun, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon (he was the first person to receive this award in the field of flower arrangement)
sen.cmt: 池坊公式HPでは受賞年度が2006年となっていましたが、原文どおり2005年で訳出しました。
sen.e: 2005: He received the Order of the Rising Sun, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon (he was the first person to receive this award in the field of flower arrangement)
2005: He received the Order of the Rising Sun, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon (he was the first person to receive this award in the field of flower arrangement)
